definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: Hezbollah fought a 34-day war with Israel in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 真主黨在2006年的時候跟以色列交火34天。

sentences.english: Qiao Jishan line with puppet fire door.
sentences.chinese: 喬繼山一行同門口僞軍交火。

sentences.english: Mexican navy kills top cartel kingpin in shootout.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥大毒梟在與海軍交火中被打死。

sentences.english: Intensive exchange of fire is continuing in the vicinity of An-Nasiriya.
sentences.chinese: 激烈的交火在納西里亞附近繼續。

sentences.english: One looter was killed when the 2 sides exchanged fire.
sentences.chinese: 雙方發生交火，一名哄搶者被擊斃。

sentences.english: Catching the black king in a crossfire leading to checkmate.
sentences.chinese: 在帶領圍擒的一個交火中捕捉黑色的國王。

sentences.english: North and South Korea exchanged gunfire near their disputed maritime border.
sentences.chinese: 南北韓於備受爭議的海上邊境交火。

sentences.english: It was, Hughes said, a "firefighting" form of grandparenting.
sentences.chinese: 卡琳博士說，這是種祖父母生活的‘交火’狀態。

sentences.english: DPRK, S. Korea Trade Fire, at least 2 soldiers killed.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮，韓國交火，至少導致2名士兵死亡。

sentences.english: Bin Laden's body was retrieved after a brief firefight.
sentences.chinese: 拉登的屍體在一次簡單的交火後便被美軍獲取。

sentences.english: He heard small arms and some rifle fire.
sentences.chinese: 他聽到一些小型武器和來復槍交火的聲音。

sentences.english: Three cops got shot in the crossfire with the criminals.
sentences.chinese: 在與罪犯交火時三名警察被擊中。

sentences.english: Wang Shaoqiang rate department to catch up with Xu Dianting a pedestrian, the two sides exchanged fire again.
sentences.chinese: 王少強率部追上了許殿亭一行人，雙方再次交火。

sentences.english: He said U.S. forces killed bin Laden after a firefight and took custody of his body.
sentences.chinese: 他說，美軍在交火後打死了拉登，並掌握了他的屍體。

sentences.english: Two policemen were wounded in the shootout.
sentences.chinese: 在交火中有兩名警察受傷。

sentences.english: All three criminals got shot in the crossfire.
sentences.chinese: 在交火時三名罪犯全部被擊中。

definition: lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
